questions.question_text: A systems administrator is tasked to add an existing user to an existing group on a local Linux system. Which of the following files should be edited to accomplish this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
usermod -aG groupname username should do the job

questions.question_text: A server technician is performing a server installation. This server must be able to resolve host names for users running a variety of client operating systems. At a minimum, which of the following services should be enabled on the new server? (Select TWO).

comments.content:
I think this question is old back then, WINS is required long time ago.
Since the question only mention about "resolve host names" and there is only "A" server.
I think B & D are still the most "suitable" answers at this point

discussion.content: I think this should be DNS and DHCP if you have to pick two, but really you should only need DNS if DHCP is running elsewhere. I may be overthinking the second part, but WINS is certainly not a requirement.

The other answer should be: B. TFTP
Why?:
"PXE is an open industry standard supported by a number of hardware and software vendors. ... The PXE-enabled NIC of the client sends out a broadcast request to DHCP server, which returns with the IP address of the client along with the address of the TFTP server, and the location of boot files on the TFTP server."
The exam is only showing one answer while the question is asking for two answers.

questions.question_text: An administrator is deploying 1000 new servers in a datacenter. A vendor will install the servers on racks and connect cables. Which of the following technologies would BEST for the administrator to use to install operating systems to all 1000 servers in the shortest time possible? (Select two.)

choices.B: The NICs should be placed into a team with one MAC address.
choices.A: The NICs should be configured separately with one MAC address.
choices.C: The NICs should be configured separately with two MAC addresses.
choices.D: The NICs should be placed into a team with two MAC addresses.

discussion.content:
ChatGPT thinks its D 
D. The NICs should be placed into a team with two MAC addresses.

To achieve fault protection and load balancing, the two integrated NICs in the new web server should be placed into a team (also known as NIC teaming or bonding). NIC teaming combines multiple network interfaces into a single logical interface, providing fault tolerance and increased bandwidth.

When NIC teaming is enabled, both NICs work together as a single virtual NIC with two physical connections. This configuration ensures redundancy and fault protection. If one NIC fails or encounters an issue, the other NIC will continue to handle the network traffic, preventing downtime.

Additionally, placing the NICs into a team with two MAC addresses allows the team to be recognized as a distinct entity on the network, which is essential for proper load balancing and fault tolerance. The teaming software typically handles load distribution and failover to ensure optimal performance and reliability.

questions.question_text: A server technician is replacing a web server in an organization. The new server has two integrated NICs. Which of the following describes how the NICs should be configured for fault protection?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
snapshots provide 'the shortest amount of time possible' restoration

choices.D: A system recovery point made with the OS
choices.A: A storage-level snapshot made on the SAN
choices.E: A bit-level image stored on an SSD in the VM host
choices.C: A full file-system backup stored on an LTO tape
choices.B: A full file-system backup stored on the SAN

questions.question_text: An administrator is attempting an OS upgrade on a VM disk that is stored on a SAN. In the event of a failure, the administrator wants to ensure the system can return to a working state in the shortest amount of time possible. Which of the following backup methods would BEST accomplish this?
